lines.content: Duke is an application project that is designed to help users to keep track different types of tasks. For example: todos, deadlines and events.
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your computer.
## Setting Up in IntelliJ version 2020.3.1 (latest) and beyond
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1.Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1.If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into IntelliJ as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ip.duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ip.duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the output below.
Here are some available commands and their corresponding input format:
list: Display all tasks in the list.
Format: deadline submit a report /by 05 Mar
done: Mark a task as done.
find: find all tasks contain the input keyword
date: find all tasks occurring the specific date
* Adds a todo task which has no time limit to finish
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.
* Adds a deadline task which has to be completed before a given time
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.
* Adds an event task which will start at a given time
* Example: `event project group meeting /at 2-4 pm Sunday`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.
* Display all recorded tasks in the list
Here are the tasks in your list:
* Marks a certain task to be done
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a done cannot be empty.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a delete cannot be empty.
* Finds the tasks that contains the certain keyword given by user
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a find cannot be empty.
* Finds all the tasks that are relevant to the specific date
Here are the tasks occurring on this specific date:
üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a date cannot be empty.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* The command is not acceptable by Duke
üôÅ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(
Duke is an application project that is designed to help users to keep track different types of tasks. For example: todos, deadlines and events.
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your computer.
## Setting Up in IntelliJ version 2020.3.1 (latest) and beyond
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1.Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1.If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into IntelliJ as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ip.duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ip.duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the output below.
Here are some available commands and their corresponding input format:
list: Display all tasks in the list.
Format: deadline submit a report /by 05 Mar
done: Mark a task as done.
find: find all tasks contain the input keyword
date: find all tasks occurring the specific date

Now you have 2 tasks in the list.

üôÅ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(
* Builds a Java project named Duke to store tasks in a given address.
* a Duke(filepath) object represents a Duke project
* that store all task information in file at the path of filepath
* The constructor for a Duke object, returns nothing
* loading the task information that already exist in the file
* which is written by previous runs before each run
* @param filePath the address of the file storing all task information into a certain taskList
* @throws IOException the exception that occurs when encountered with problems in writing to
* Starts the program by printing greeting information.
* The program continues running to get the commands from user inputs until
* the user's input is an instruction (bye) to exit the program.
* The program helps to store all task information into a certain file
* @throws DukeException when the command received in is incomplete or different from any acceptable commands
* @throws IOException   the exception that occurs when encountered with problems in writing to
* Exits the program by printing a bye message.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Represents all possible exceptions when incomplete or incorrect command is typed in
* Parses the user's input into a format that can be recognized by the Duke project program.
* Apart from "help" "list" and "bye" commands, all other valid commands must be followed by further information.
* If the input is not an acceptable command or cannot be recognized correctly by this program
* @param input the string input by user, which is regarded as a command
* @throws DukeException an exception that occurs when an invalid command is input
public static void parseCommand(String input) throws DukeException {
* Represents an object that deals with loading information from a file
* as well as writing information into it
* A Storage(filepath) object corresponds to an object that can read and write
* into the file at the path given by filepath
public static ArrayList<Task> list = new ArrayList<>();
* Constructs a Storage object to access the data in the given address.
* @param filePath the String given to find the path of the file.
* Loads the data stored in the given file address and re-formats them into a task list.
* If the file does not exist, create a new file to store the task information
* The stored data may contain three types todo, deadline, and event with their corresponding task status.
* @return the task list that read from that file
* @throws IOException an exception occurs when encountered with problems reading into the file
public static ArrayList<Task> loadData() throws IOException {
System.out.println("Since the file does not exist, I have created a new one.");
* Update a todo type task read from the file to the task list.
* @param list        the list that stores all the tasks
* @param description the string that describe this todo task
* @param isDone      the status of this todo tasks
public static void fileUpdateTodo(ArrayList<Task> list, String description, boolean isDone) {
* Update a deadline type task read from the file to the task list.
* @param list        the list that stores all the tasks
* @param description the string that describe this todo task
* @param byTime      the string representing the latest time the task should be done
* @param isDone      the status of this todo tasks
public static void fileUpdateDeadline(ArrayList<Task> list, String description, String byTime, boolean isDone) {
* Update an event type task read from the file to the task list.
* @param list        the list that stores all the tasks
* @param description the string that describe this todo task
* @param atTime      the string representing the time the task should start
* @param isDone      the status of this todo tasks
public static void fileUpdateEvent(ArrayList<Task> list, String description, String atTime, boolean isDone) {
* Save the updated task list information as data format
* back to the given file address whenever the task list changes.
* if the ArrayList is empty, nothing will be written
* @throws IOException an exception occurs when encountered with problems writing to the file
public static void saveData() throws IOException {
* Constructs a new task list if there is no data stored in the given address.
* Constructs a task list by reading from the file in the given address.
* @param list the task list that is read from the file in the given address
* Updates a todo type task into the task list and confirms the operation by printing a message
* @param description the description of this todo task obtained by parsing the user's input command
* Updates a deadline type task into the task list and confirms the operation by printing a message
* @param description the description of this deadline task obtained by parsing the user's input command
* @param byTime      the latest time of this task should be done obtain by parsing the user's input command
public static void updateDeadline(String description, String byTime) {
* Updates an event type task into the task list and confirms the operation by printing a message
* @param description the description of this deadline task obtained by parsing the user's input command
* @param atTime      the start time of this task obtain by parsing the user's input command
public static void updateEvent(String description, String atTime) {
* Marks the indicated user's input task as done and confirms the marking operation by printing a message.
* @param doneIndex the index of the task that to be marked as done
* Deletes the indicated user's input task from the task list and confirms the marking operation by printing a message.
* @param deletedIndex the index of the task that to be deleted
* Obtains the tasks that contains the keyword that input by the user and stores them in another task list.
* Prints the new list obtained before
* Prints the warning message if there is no matching task in the new task list
* @param keywordToFind the keyword that the user want all the matching tasks to contain
* Obtains the tasks that contains the date that input by the user and stores them in another task list.
* Prints the new list obtained before
* Prints the warning message if there is no matching task in the new task list
* @param dateToFind the date that the user wants all the matching tasks to contain
* Prints the Duke logo and the greeting message when the program starts to run.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Prints an error message when there is no data stored in the text file to be loaded.
System.out.println("There is no existing data to load... ");
* Prints the corresponding error message for different type of invalid inputs.
* @param input the invalid input which is not a command or does not provide enough information
System.out.println("üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of a " + input + " cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("üôÅ OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("üôÅ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Prints all acceptable commands and the input examples of this project
System.out.println("Here are some available commands and their corresponding input format: ");
"\nlist: Display all tasks in the list." +
"\nfind: find all tasks contain the input keyword" +
"\ndate: find all tasks occurring the specific date" +
* Prints a message to confirm the task updated successfully by printing the formatted task
* and the current number of tasks in the updated task list.
* @param task the new task to be updated into the task list
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + (TaskList.getSize()) + " tasks in the list. ");
* Prints all the tasks in the list.
* @param list the task list to be displayed
* Prints the list of tasks that matches the find input.
* @param foundList the list of tasks that contains the finding keyword
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Prints the list of tasks that matches the find input.
* @param dateList the list of tasks that contains the finding keyword
System.out.println("Here are the tasks occurring on this specific date: ");
* Prints a message to confirm marking a task as done successfully by printing the formatted task
* @param task the task to be marked as done
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Prints a message to confirm deleting a task successfully by printing the formatted task
* and the current number of tasks in the task list.
* @param task the task to be marked as done
System.out.println("Now you have " + (TaskList.getSize() - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints an error message if the task matches the find input cannot be found.
System.out.println("There is no matching task in your list.");
* Prints an error message if the task matches the find input cannot be found.
System.out.println("There is no task occurring on this specific date.");
* Prints the bye message before the program ends.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a type of task with description and a deadline (date or time)
* status is undone unless marked done by the user
* Represents a type of task with description and a startTime (date or time)
* status is undone by default unless marked done by the user
* status is undone by default unless marked done by user
* Constructs a Task object with a given description and a default task status of undone.
* @param description the string given to describe this task
* Returns the string format of the task to output the task when the program is running.
* @return the string format of this task with its status and description for output
* Returns the string format of the task to write the task into the file.
* @return the string format of this task with its status and description for data saving
* Represents a type of task with description only
* status is undone by default unless user marks it as done
